arts.ttl: FPL notes: Bruno hauls, Heaven injury + Leicester’s awful run
arts.sum: What we saw at the King Power Stadium The post FPL notes: Bruno hauls, Heaven injury + Leicester’s awful run appeared first on Best FPL Tips, Advice, Team News, Picks, and Statistics from Fantasy Football Scout.

arts.ttl: Ruben Amorim insists his Man United side are still 'SO far away' from the standards he demands... despite their 3-0 triumph over Leicester
arts.sum: Ruben Amorim admitted Manchester United are still a huge distance from the standard demanded by their fans despite their second win in four days.

arts.ttl: Fernandes central to Man United's much-needed win at Leicester
arts.sum: Bruno Fernandes assisted on two Manchester United goals before netting one himself in their 3-0 Premier League win at Leicester City on Sunday.

arts.ttl: Leicester 0-3 Manchester United: Rasmus Hojlund and Alejandro Garnacho end goal droughts but Ayden Heaven injured
arts.sum: Red Devils deepen Ruud van Nistelrooy’s plight as relegation-threatened Foxes suffer their 13th loss in 14 Premier League matches

arts.ttl: Rasmus Højlund ends goal drought as Manchester United cruise past Leicester
arts.athr: Ben Fisher at the King Power Stadium
arts.sum: Jamie Vardy rolled the ball into the Manchester United net to huge cheers and about 10 minutes later, amid swirling rain, Ruud van Nistelrooy’s name echoed around this stadium. The only problem for Leicester City was Vardy sent the ball over the line during a break in play while Ayden Heaven, forced off early in the second half, received treatment, and it was the United supporters singing about Van Nistelrooy. The Dutchman took charge of United in the reverse fixture in November, signing off from his spell in interim charge with a 3-0 victory, but this time he was on the receiving end of the same scoreline. That four-match unbeaten run with United must feel halcyonic for Van Nistelrooy, who has now lost 13 of his past 14 league matches. The numbers make grisly reading: Leicester have not scored here since early December and after firing blanks in this defeat they recorded unwanted history, becoming the first Premier League team to lose seven home matches in a row without scoring. Leicester are nine points adrift of 17th-placed Wolves and have a vastly inferior goal difference. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: ‘I hope’: Bruno Fernandes makes odd request to Rasmus Hojlund after scoring against Leicester
arts.sum: Bruno Fernandes was at the heart of another improved Manchester United performance in the Premier League, a 3-0 win away to Ruud van Nistelrooy’s struggling...

arts.ttl: Fernandes stars as Man Utd extend unbeaten run with win at Leicester
arts.sum: Bruno Fernandes produced another captain's performance - scoring one goal, and assisting the others for Rasmus Hojlund and Alejandro Garnacho - as Manchester United extended their unbeaten run with a 3-0 win at struggling Leicester City . In a real quirk of the record books, Ruud van Nistelrooy – who was in the Red Devils’ dugout when these teams met back in November – became the first manager to take charge of both clubs in a specific Premier League fixture in the same season since Alan Pardew in 2014/15 ( Crystal Palace v Newcastle United ).

arts.ttl: Man United head coach Ruben Amorim addresses Ayden Heaven injury after centre-back is stretchered off against Leicester
arts.sum: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim admits that "it's hard to know" the extent of Ayden Heaven's injury at this stage of proceedings.

arts.ttl: Hojlund, Garnacho lead United rout of Leicester
arts.sum: Manchester United's Rasmus Hojlund and Alejandro Garnacho ended goal droughts and Bruno Fernandes scored to earn a 3-0 win at struggling Leicester.

arts.ttl: Leicester 0-3 Man United: Highlights, man of the match, stats as two goalscoring droughts come to an end in Red Devils success
arts.sum: Rasmus Hojlund and Alejandro Garnacho both end long goalscoring droughts in Manchester United's 3-0 victory over Leicester City in the Premier League.
